image.altText: Four volunteers dressed in uniform at dawn service.

props.synopsis: 110 years after Australian and New Zealand soldiers landed on the Turkish coastline at Gallipoli, thousands of people have come together to mark Anzac day.

title.children: 'We feel them still near us in spirit': Thousands turn out to mark Anzac Day

image.altText: ANZAC Dawn service at Melbourne's Shine of Remembrance

props.synopsis: Gunditjmara man Uncle Mark Brown was booed and heckled by members of the crowd at Melbourne's Shrine of Remembrance on Friday morning.

title.children: 'Neo-nazis' condemned for disrupting Anzac Day service in Melbourne

image.altText: Pilbara Minerals spodumene rock

props.synopsis: China now dominates the entire rare earths ecosystem, refining around 90 per cent of all coveted elements. It leaves Trump's America particularly vulnerable, as the Albanese government proposes a national stockpile.

title.children: How Trump dealt himself a dud hand on rare earths

image.altText: Four brand new cars on a production line are inspected by factory workers.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's promise to end electric vehicle subsidies could drive up prices for popular EVs by more than $15,000 under a typical novated lease and have an almost immediate effect on sales.

title.children: Coalition vow to end EV lease discount may inflate prices $15K

image.altText: Perth Anzac 2

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is spending Anzac Day morning in Canberra, while Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is campaigning in his home city of Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: Politicians respond to 'disgraceful' booing at dawn service

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ambassador hails Australian volunteer fighters as 'Ukrainian Anzacs'
PM: 'A neo-Nazi disrupting Anzac Day is abhorrent'
'Their actions should be condemned': Dutton on dawn service incident

image.altText: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin shake hands

props.synopsis: The US president has demanded Moscow cease bombardments of the Ukrainian capital as Washington attempts to broker a peace deal.

title.children: 'Vladimir, STOP!' Trump criticises Putin over Russian missile attack on Kyiv

image.altText: Peter Dutton with Andrew Hastie, campaigning in Perth

props.synopsis: Whatever the result on May 3, even people within the Liberals think they have run a very poor national campaign. Not just poor, but odd.

title.children: Coalition's campaign lacks good planning and enough elbow grease

image.altText: Pauline Hanson with daughter Lee Hanson with some hot chips.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson, the leader of One Nation, has worked in politics for nearly three decades. Now, her daughter Lee is hoping to join her — running as a Senate candidate in southern Tasmania.

title.children: 'I wouldn't put any of my sons in there': Hanson on daughter's Senate tilt

image.altText: Composite Duttts Albo

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese have yet to set foot in an Indigenous community during their election campaigns. However, both have made multiple visits to Melbourne.

title.children: The places political leaders have been avoiding this election

image.altText: A man holds a sign at a protest that reads, "Water crimes, war crimes" among a sea of green and white flags

props.synopsis: Relations between India and Pakistan deteriorate after an attack left 26 people dead, with New Delhi blaming Islamabad for the violence.

title.children: Rift between India and Pakistan deepens after mass tourist shooting

image.altText: A coffin, seen through the screen on a smart phone

props.synopsis: A Vatican official tells the ABC that taking pictures of, or with, the deceased pontiff is "frowned upon", as people snapping selfies becomes a phenomenon inside St Peter's Basilica.

title.children: Vatican responds as crowds take 'creepy' selfies with pope's body

image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: Line of people voting at Perth polling station.

props.synopsis: More than a million people have already cast their ballots for the federal election early. Some experts say the polling day has just become the last day to vote.

title.children: Early voting becomes new normal in Australia

image.altText: US defense secretary pete hegseth smirks at the camera

props.synopsis: The unsecured internet connection is the latest revelation about Mr Hegseth's use of the app and raises the possibility that sensitive defence information could have been hacked.

title.children: Hegseth had 'dirty' internet line in his office to use Signal, sources say

image.altText: St Peter's square with thousands of people in the crowd

props.synopsis: One of the pontiff's last acts was to simplify papal rites, stripping away elaborate rituals and scaling back ceremonial pomp.

title.children: When is Pope Francis's funeral? What to know about the ceremony and burial

image.altText: Ralph Fiennes talkes to a fellow cardinal in the film Conclave.

props.synopsis: As Conclave movie streaming tops Australia's watch list, we go behind the scenes with its cast and a historian, while real life cardinals rush to The Vatican.

title.children: What the film Conclave gets right (and wrong) about electing a new pope

image.altText: Man in plane wearing beret looking back at camera

props.synopsis: A World War II bomber pilot from Sydney reflects on his teary reunion with his mother, the Normandy landing and life after the war for Anzac Day 2025.

title.children: 102yo WWII veteran reflects on his 'marvellous' return home

image.altText: A woman in a white top smiles and her 2 year old son sit at a table, look at the camera smiling

props.synopsis: Tax rebates for rural Australians were last updated more than 30 years ago. Voters say it is time for them to be on the election agenda.

title.children: Rural voters want zonal tax offset updates this election

image.altText: Beverley Minogue

props.synopsis: A pilot program at one of Australia's biggest emergency departments halves the number of older patients admitted to hospital.

title.children: Hospital admissions plummet under program helping elderly patients

image.altText: Boy and man 2

props.synopsis: Linford Feick is remembered as a "true legend" with a "heart of gold", as the Darwin community gathers to remember the local grocer who was stabbed to death at his store.

title.children: Darwin community grieves for supermarket stabbing victim

image.altText: The exterior of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, with barbed wire in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A former inmate at Darwin's notorious Don Dale Youth Detention Centre claims he was forced to "fight other children" and spend hours cutting grass with scissors in a lawsuit against the NT government.

title.children: Lawsuit claims Don Dale teens forced to fight for guards' 'entertainment'

image.altText: Two seashells.

props.synopsis: A school student has discovered a "very, very rare" seashell during a school holiday session at the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery.

title.children: 8yo girl makes 'astounding' discovery of tiny, rare seashell at museum

image.altText: A group of people running under trees.

props.synopsis: An increasing number of women are signing up to local run clubs, even tackling their first marathon. But safety fears once the sun sets are hampering their training efforts.

title.children: How women's running changes once the sun sets

image.altText: Political candidate advertising a-frames set up on a lawn.

props.synopsis: The retirement of the incumbent and a well-resourced campaign from a local surgeon turned independent is shaking up the status quo in the seat of Forrest.

title.children: Federal WA seat 'vulnerable' after 50 years as safe Liberal territory

image.altText: A smiling young blonde woman with a black dog.

props.synopsis: The 53-year-old Sydney man accused of murdering the 19-year-old earlier this year has been found dead in his cell at Silverwater Correctional Complex.

title.children: Man charged with Audrey Griffin's murder found dead in prison cell

image.altText: A group of police officers walking down a road securing a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A French high school student has killed one of his classmates and wounded three others, the latest in a spate of school incidents in the European country.

title.children: Macron hails 'courage' of teachers after deadly France school stabbing

image.altText: Sitili Tupouniua runs off the field in the rain as the referee signals a cross with his arms during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Canterbury's first loss of 2025 comes at an even bigger cost, with Sitili Tupouniua, Josh Curran and Matt Burton facing a combined nine weeks on the sidelines even with early guilty pleas.

title.children: Bulldogs facing two months' worth of bans after Broncos loss

image.altText: Ella Ramsay and Tara Kinder swim breaststroke composite

props.synopsis: Ella Ramsay and Tara Kinder could barely be separated all week, lining up in four finals across the Australian Open Swimming Championships in Brisbane, sharing four golds and four silvers between them.

title.children: The burgeoning rivalry that lit up the Australian swimming titles

image.altText: A man in a sweater stands in a native forest in New South Wales

props.synopsis: Former treasure secretary Ken Henry is pushing a new effort to protect native forests from logging and keep carbon stored in living trees.

title.children: Former treasury boss looking past logging to 'grow money on trees'

image.altText: A man holds a piglet inside a piggery barn.

props.synopsis: Australia's $6 billion pork industry is still waiting for a vaccine three years after a deadly outbreak of Japanese encephalitis virus.

title.children: Pork industry waits for vaccine three years after viral outbreak

image.altText: A closeup of hands securing a round red pipe cutter onto a copper pipe.

props.synopsis: Copper thieves are suspected of targeting vacant homes using real estate websites, leaving real estate agents and plumbers to clean up the mess and owners to foot the bill.

title.children: Copper thieves using real estate listings to target vacant properties

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: A new economic report commissioned by the Hobart City Council has found the stadium will deliver more than $140 million in economic impact to Hobart per year during the construction phase, and $178 million when operational.

title.children: New Hobart stadium report sought to address economic 'missed opportunity'

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Elephants pack their trunks, a trailblazing pope and an exchange of nice words

image.altText: A woman sits with a typewriter on a brown wooden table.

props.synopsis: Pam Ashman has sat courtside for thousands of netball games, keeping score by hand and recording fixtures on her typewriter. Despite the painstaking work, the 78-year-old volunteer vows to "never ever" use a computer.

title.children: Trusty typewriter and a dedicated volunteer keeps netball league on track
